caption.center: STATE of Maine v. Stephen BAILEY.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Superior Court, Cumberland County.
opinion.attorneys:
Paul Aranson, Dist. Atty., and Steven Juskewitch (orally), Asst. Dist. Atty., Portland, for plaintiff.
Daniel Bates (orally), Portland, for defendant.
opinion.panel: Before McKUSICK, C.J., and NICHOLS, ROBERTS, WATHEN, GLASSMAN, SCOLNIK and CLIFFORD, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
MEMORANDUM OF DECISION.
Stephen Bailey, on appeal from a judgment of the Superior Court, Cumberland County, challenges the sufficiency of the evidence to support the finding of guilt of criminal mischief with a dangerous weapon, 17-A M.R.S.A. ยง 806, 1252 (1983) and of two counts of reckless conduct with the use of a firearm,17-A M.R.S.A. ยง 211, 1252(4), (5) (1983). The record discloses that the trier of fact rationally could have found every element of the crimes beyond a reasonable doubt. See State v. Barry,495 A.2d 825, 826 (Me. 1985).
The entry is:
Judgment affirmed.
All concurring.
